questionnaireInfo.text: Welcome to the OpenMetaDesign Research Study!

Thank you very much for participating in the OpenMetaDesign Research Study!

For more information on this research study or in case of any questions, please contact: Massimo Menichinelli – +34 657341068 – massimo.menichinelli@aalto.fi

sectionInfo.text:
By giving my consent I confirm my voluntary participation in the OpenMetaDesign research study. I have received sufficient information about the research study, I have had the possibility to have my questions answered, I have understood the information and I wish to participate in the research study.

The research data is handled confidentially so that it is coded in a way that will not reveal my identity and it will be anonymized for academic publications and other research projects. I also give my consent to use the anonymous research data mentioned above in other research projects and academic publications.

I have understood that participation is entirely voluntary and at any point in the research study I can withdraw my consent and discontinue participation in the research. I am also aware that the data collected up to withdrawal will be used as part of the research data.

For more information on this research study or in case of any questions, please contact: Massimo Menichinelli – +34 657341068 – massimo.menichinelli@aalto.fi

question.text: Do you agree with the privacy policy?

directive.text: By clicking “Yes” below you are indicating that you have read and understood this consent form and agree to participate in this research study.

sectionInfo.text: We would like to ask you few questions about you, in order to understand you better and if and how OpenMetaDesign could be useful for you.

question.text: What is your name?

directive.text: Please write your name and surname. Your data will be anonymized right after this research study.

question.text: What is your age?

directive.text: Please indicate your age with a number.

question.text: With which gender do you most identify with?
Where are you from?

directive.text: Please indicate your citizenship (one option only is allowed).

category.label: The Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia

question.text: To which of these categories would you identify to?
What is the highest degree or level of school you have completed? If currently enrolled, highest degree received.

category.label: Lower secondary ("Licenza media inferiore" in Italy)
Upper secondary ("Diploma scuola superiore" in Italy)
Bachelor or equivalent ("Laurea triennale" in Italy)
Master or equivalent ("Laurea magistrale" in Italy)
Doctoral or equivalent ("Dottorato di ricerca" in Italy)

question.text: What is the field of the highest degree or level of school you have completed?

directive.text: Please indicate the field of your highest degree or level of school you have completed.

question.text: What is your work experience?

directive.text: Please describe your past work experience, especially whenever realted to your open and making practice.

question.text: Which are your interests regarding your future work?

directive.text: Please describe your possible or desired future work experience that could be related to your open and making practice. Any expectation, desire, planned strategy that might be relevant here?

sectionInfo.text: We would like to ask you a few questions about you and your relations with making, in order to understand better how OpenMetaDesign could support your making initiatives.

question.text: For how long have you been interested in making?
How have you been engaged with making?

category.label: I am a Maker myself (>5 years)
I am a Fab Lab manager
I am a Maker Faire organizer
I don't really consider myself a Maker yet

question.text: Is making your main professional activity?

category.label: No, it’s a secondary professional activity

question.text: What is your ambition with respect to the Maker Movement?

directive.text: Please rate each of these sentences on a 1 to 5 scale.

subQuestion.text: My ambition with making is commercially oriented
My ambition with making is socially oriented
My ambition with making is policy oriented
My ambition with making is research oriented
My ambition with making is local community oriented
My ambition with making is technically oriented

sectionInfo.text: We would like to ask you a few questions about you and your relations with Open Design, in order to understand better how OpenMetaDesign could support your open and making initiatives.

question.text: Are you interested in adopting Open Source software, hardware and design for your future projects?

directive.text: Please specify if you are interested in adopting an Open Source software, hardware and design approach for possible future projects.

category.label: No, to no projects at all

question.text: What would you release openly in your future projects?

directive.text: Please choose all the relevant options. They indicate your possible interest in adopting Open Source software, hardware and design in the future.

category.label: Documentation of the process/manufacturing/use of the project
Use of existing open source software in my work
Use of existing open source hardware in my work
Use of existing open source design in my work

question.text: What do you find interesting in Open Design?

directive.text: Please indicate which are the aspects of Open Design that are most interesting to you.

question.text: How difficult is for you to understand the concept of Open Design and its implications?

directive.text: Please rate this sentence on a 1 to 5 scale.

category.label: 1 - I cannot understand it at all
2 - I can understand very little of it
4 - I can understand most of it

question.text: What do you find difficult in understanding Open Design?

directive.text: Please choose all the aspects that you find difficult in understanding Open Design.

category.label: Intellectual Property concepts, applications and strategies
Tools for managing the resources and files
Tools for the coordination of collaborative processes (sequences of activities)
Tools for the coordination of collaborative systems (actors, roles, interactions, organizations, places)

question.text: What do you find difficult or missing in adopting an Open Design approach for your future projects?

directive.text: Please choose all the aspects that you find difficult in adopting Open Design for your possible future projects.

category.label: Intellectual Property concepts, applications and strategies
Tools for managing the resources and files
Tools for the coordination of collaborative processes (sequences of activities)
Tools for the coordination of collaborative systems (actors, roles, interactions, organizations, places)

sectionInfo.text: Organization in your open and making practice before this research study

We would like to ask you a few questions about your experience in the organization of your making and open practice before this research study, in order to understand better how OpenMetaDesign could support it.

question.text: How did you experience the processes of working in your open and making practice so far?

directive.text: Please choose one of these options, about how you experienced the processes of working together with other people in your open and making practice so far.

category.label: I never noticed any organized process, everything was decided at each moment
There were at least sometimes processes with a certain structure, and I understood it
There were at least sometimes processes with a certain structure, and I understood it and designed it with other people

question.text: How did you experience the whole systems (actors, roles, interactions, organizations, places) in your open and making practice so far?

directive.text: Please choose one of these options, about how you experienced the whole systems (intended as connections and interactions among actors, roles, organizations, places that you worked with) of working together with other people in your open and making practice so far.

category.label: I did not notice any organized systems, the differences between these entities were not clear
There was at least sometimes a system with a certain structure, and I understood it
There was at least sometimes a system with a certain structure, and I understood it and designed it with the others

question.text: Did you find any collaboration among people in your open and making practice so far, and how was it?

directive.text: Please choose one of these options regarding how you perceived the collaboration happening among all the people participating in your open and making practice so far.

category.label: Collaborative discussion about the project but work on individual projects/components
Collaborative design of the same files/components

question.text: How was the work coordinated during your open and making practice so far?

directive.text: Please write something about how you coordinate your personal work within your open and making practice so far.

question.text: Did you notice any form of organization of the work and roles present in the processes in your open and making practice so far?

directive.text: Please describe any form of organization of the work among the participants you noticed in your open and making practice so far, if roles were presents, task assigned, and decision-making processes in place.

question.text: How would you describe your idea of collaborative design processes using metaphors?

directive.text: Please describe how you imagine collaborative design processes using metaphors.

question.text: How would you describe your idea of collaborative design organizations using metaphors?

directive.text: Please describe how you imagine collaborative design organizations using metaphors.

question.text: Rate how much you used these tools in the coordination of your work in your open and making practice so far.

directive.text: Please indicate the percentage of how the usage of these tools/dynamics for coordinating your work with other people in your open and making practice so far. The sum of all the items must be 100.

sectionInfo.text: Organization in your group during this research study

We would like to ask you a few questions about your experience in the organization of your making and open practice during this research study, in order to understand better how OpenMetaDesign could support it.

question.text: How did you experience the whole process of working during this research study?

directive.text: Please choose one of these options, about how you experienced the whole process of working together with other people during this research study.

category.label: I did not notice an organized process, everything was decided at each moment
There was a process with a certain structure, and I understood it
There was a process with a certain structure, and I understood it and designed it with the others

question.text: How did you experience the whole systems (actors, roles, interactions, organizations, places) during this research study?

directive.text: Please choose one of these options, about how you experienced the whole system (intended as connections and interactions among actors, roles, organizations, places that you worked with) of working together with other people during this research study.

category.label: I did not notice an organized system, the differences between these entities were not clear
There was a system with a certain structure, and I understood it
There was a system with a certain structure, and I understood it and designed it with the others

question.text: Did you find any collaboration among participants during this research study, and how was it?

directive.text: Please choose one of these options regarding how you perceived the collaboration happening among all the people participating in this research study.

category.label: Collaborative discussion about the project but work on individual projects/components
Collaborative design of the same files/components

question.text: How was the work coordinated during this research study?

directive.text: Please write something about how you coordinate your personal work during this research study.

question.text: Did you notice any form of organization of the work and roles present in the process during this research study?

directive.text: Please describe any form of organization of the work among the participants you noticed during this research study, if roles were presents, task assigned, and decision-making processes in place.

sectionInfo.text: Interactions in your group before the research study

We would like to ask you a few questions about your experience of the interactions in your open and making practice with the other participants before this research study, in order to understand better how OpenMetaDesign could support you.

question.text: Who are the other participants in this research study?

directive.text: Please list the names of the other participants in this research study.

question.text: With whom of the other participants in this research study have you already worked together in open and making initiatives?

directive.text: Please select all the corresponding options.

question.text: How often have you interacted (worked, discussed, ...) with the other participants in the development of making and open source initiative before this research study?

directive.text: Please rate all the interactions with each of these participants on a 1 to 5 scale.

question.text: How positive or negative have been your interactions with the other participants during the open and making practice before this research study?

directive.text: Please rate all the interactions with each of these participants on a 1 to 5 scale.

question.text: How do often do you think all the participants in this research study have collaborated among them in making and open source initiative before?

directive.text: Please rate the interactions among all the participants on a 1 to 5 scale (multiple choice).

question.text: How do often do you think all the participants in this research study have collaborated among them in making and open source initiative before?

directive.text: Please rate the interactions among all the participants on a 1 to 5 scale (multiple choice).

directive.text: Please rate the interactions among all the participants on a 1 to 5 scale (multiple choice).

question.text: How do often do you think all the participants in this research study have collaborated among them in making and open source initiative before?

directive.text: Please rate the interactions among all the participants on a 1 to 5 scale (multiple choice).

question.text: How positive or negative do you think the collaborations among all the participants have been in the development of making and open source initiatives before this research study?

directive.text: Please choose all the applicable options (multiple choice) rating them on a 1 to 5 scale.

question.text: How positive or negative do you think the collaborations among all the participants have been in the development of making and open source initiatives before this research study?

directive.text: Please choose all the applicable options (multiple choice) rating them on a 1 to 5 scale.

question.text: How positive or negative do you think the collaborations among all the participants have been in the development of making and open source initiatives before this research study?

directive.text: Please choose all the applicable options (multiple choice) rating them on a 1 to 5 scale.

question.text: How positive or negative do you think the collaborations among all the participants have been in the development of making and open source initiatives before this research study?

directive.text: Please choose all the applicable options (multiple choice) rating them on a 1 to 5 scale.

question.text: How positive or negative do you think the collaborations among all the participants have been in the development of making and open source initiatives before this research study?

directive.text: Please choose all the applicable options (multiple choice) rating them on a 1 to 5 scale.

We would like to ask you a few questions about your experience of the interactions in your open and making practice with the other participants during this research study, in order to understand better how OpenMetaDesign could support you.

directive.text: Please rate all the interactions with each of these participants on a 1 to 5 scale.

sectionInfo.text: We would like to ask you few questions about you and your experience with OpenMetaDesign, in order to understand better how it could be useful for you and how it could be improved in the future.

question.text: How would you rate the usability of OpenMetaDesign?

directive.text: Please rate each of these sentences on a 1 to 5 scale.

subQuestion.text: I think that I would like to use this system frequently.
I found the system unnecessarily complex.
I thought the system was easy to use.
I think that I would need the support of a technical person to be able to use this system.
I found the various functions in this system were well integrated.
I thought there was too much inconsistency in this system.
I would imagine that most people would learn to use this system very quickly.
I found the system very cumbersome to use.
I felt very confident using the system.
I needed to learn a lot of things before I could get going with this system.

question.text: How did you find OpenMetaDesign useful?

directive.text: Please rate each of these sentences on a 1 to 5 scale.

subQuestion.text: I find OpenMetaDesign useful for discussing projects
I find OpenMetaDesign useful for discussing processes
I find OpenMetaDesign useful for discussing activities
I find OpenMetaDesign useful for discussing flows
I find OpenMetaDesign useful for discussing the organization of projects
I find OpenMetaDesign useful for discussing problems in projects

question.text: What would do you use OpenMetaDesign for?

directive.text: Please decribe how you would use OpenMetaDesign, for which kind of initiatives or contexts, and in which ways.

question.text: How could we improve OpenMetaDesign?

directive.text: Please describe how OpenMetaDesign could be improved in terms of existing features, new features, changes in the visualizations and connections with other platforms and services, for example.

question.text: How do you think OpenMetaDesign could contribute to the development of the Open Design and Maker movement?

category.label: Improve the design of open and collaborative projects
Improve the manufacturing of open and collaborative projects
Improve the supply chains of open and collaborative projects
Improving the organization, coordination and collaboration within a single Maker laboratory (Fab Lab, Makerspace, Hackerspace, ...)
Improving the organization, coordination and collaboration within the networks of Maker laboratories (Fab Lab, Makerspace, Hackerspace, ...)
Improving the collaboration of Maker laboratories (Fab Lab, Makerspace, Hackerspace, ...) with non-maker organizations (companies, craftsmen, universities, workshops, associations, ... )
Connecting more people with a single Maker laboratory (Fab Lab, Makerspace, Hackerspace, ...)

question.text: What does need improvement in OpenMetaDesign?

directive.text: Please rate each of these sections on a 1 to 5 scale.
